situation: When transitioning from art class to science, J became withdrawn and slow to gather his materials, appearing anxious about the shift in activities.
action: A peer buddy system was implemented where J's classmates assisted in gently reminding him of the transition times. A transitional object, like a sketchbook with spaces for science drawings, was used to help provide continuity between classes.
effect: J felt supported and reassured having his peers guide him through transitions. The sketchbook offered a creative bridge between subjects, reducing anxiety associated with class changes. This collaborative approach enabled smoother transitions and increased social interaction.
topic: Transition Difficulties - Moving between different activities or spaces
